titles.title: To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to preclude the removal of an alien who unlawfully voted solely due to a misunderstanding of his or her eligibility to vote or citizenship status.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Claims.

bill.summary: 8/5/1999--Introduced. Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to prohibit the inadmissibility or removal of an alien who unlawfully voted if: (1) such vote was unlawful solely because the alien was not a citizen; and (2) the alien committed such violation in a good faith belief of proper U.S. citizenship or voting eligibility.
